Sentencas: Tubular segmented-in-series solid oxide fuel cells (SIS-SOFCs) are great for industry because they work more efficiently.
Titulo: Numerical study of temperature distribution in tubular segmented-in-series SOFC with co-flow and counter-flow arrangements

Sentencas: Temperature uniformity directly affects thermal stress and material degradation.
Titulo: Numerical study of temperature distribution in tubular segmented-in-series SOFC with co-flow and counter-flow arrangements

Sentencas: In this study, the coupling effect of electrochemical reaction and mass, momentum, and heat transfer within a 10-cell in-series SOFC are characterized using the finite element method.
Titulo: Numerical study of temperature distribution in tubular segmented-in-series SOFC with co-flow and counter-flow arrangements

Sentencas: The temperature distribution under co-flow and counter-flow arrangements is analyzed.
Titulo: Numerical study of temperature distribution in tubular segmented-in-series SOFC with co-flow and counter-flow arrangements

Sentencas: The results show that the maximum temperature difference under the coflow arrangement is 12% smaller than that under the counter-flow arrangement.
Titulo: Numerical study of temperature distribution in tubular segmented-in-series SOFC with co-flow and counter-flow arrangements

Sentencas: This reduction is primarily attributed to enhanced convective heat transfer on the fuel side at the location of maximum temperature within the SIS-SOFC.
Titulo: Numerical study of temperature distribution in tubular segmented-in-series SOFC with co-flow and counter-flow arrangements

Sentencas: As fuel utilization increases, the maximum temperature difference between the co-flow and counter-flow arrangements gradually decreases from 7 degrees C at the fuel utilization of 50% to 3 degrees C at the fuel utilization of 80%.
Titulo: Numerical study of temperature distribution in tubular segmented-in-series SOFC with co-flow and counter-flow arrangements

Sentencas: Meanwhile, temperature non-uniformity in the 10-cell series region of the SIS-SOFC increases gradually under the co-flow arrangement while remaining relatively unchanged under the counter-flow arrangement.
Titulo: Numerical study of temperature distribution in tubular segmented-in-series SOFC with co-flow and counter-flow arrangements
